item.description:
TIL: there are metal versions of Studio Ghibli songs.

The world is a fantastic place sometimes. ü§ò
I could go for a new album from Toad the Wet Sprocket. üéß
If I‚Äôm on the ‚Äòfeatures‚Äô page for your desktop email app, and a search for ‚Äúsecurity‚Äù has zero hits, I‚Äôm stopping right there.

I‚Äôm not sure I‚Äôm doing this right.

(Note: ‚Äòthis‚Äô is just about everything today.)
I enjoy this IG account my friend has which depicts old-timey robots.

I could use a batch delete option in Overcast. Is there one I‚Äôm overlooking?

This is probably not news to anyone, but the Timetable move caused all prior episodes to re-download. This has happened to me for other podcasts in the past. Not a frequent issue, but still a chore.
I‚Äôm not a huge fan of Grand Funk Railroad, but I totally love Inside Looking Out and Sin‚Äôs a Good Man‚Äôs Brother.
When the day comes that I get a (semi-)hollow body electric guitar, one of the first things I‚Äôll want to play on it are the solos in this song: Gene Vincent ‚Ä¢ Race with The Devil.
I like my GIF like I like my gin: tasty and satisfyingly pronounced.
I‚Äôm not big on cross-posting, but I also don‚Äôt expect Pnut.io to show up as a built-in option for m‚Ä¢b any time soon either.

Voting accomplished.

VOTE VOTE VOTE VOTE VOTE VOTE VOTE VOTE VOTE VOTE VOTE VOTE VOTE VOTE VOTE
I think I just accidentally started NaNoWriMo-ing.
I‚Äôve never had one myself, but I must say that I‚Äôm happy that the heavy metal, patch-laden denim vest tradition carries on today. I still see at least a handful at every metal show.
I think my stick-shift car (GTI) is posing some issues for the current valet staff.
Once again, my smoke machine was appreciated on Halloween.

I‚Äôve spent so long waiting for a new Mac mini, and yet I‚Äôm not ready to pull the trigger.

Let‚Äôs hope that, when I do, I don‚Äôt go for the $4200 configuration. ;)

This short episode about shipping vessel noise‚Äôs impact on dolphin communication actually made me think of Twitter & social media (less rich, yelled communication, potential impact to the young) ‚Ä¢ ‚Äò‚Ä¶sound is also an emission‚Äô

I really like Clinton Reno‚Äôs concert poster style.

I only have one of his prints myself, but he used to live here (in Cbus_OH) and I did convince him to sign the one I have. :)

Sometimes I make mistakes.

And being on muscle relaxers for a back injury don‚Äôt appear to help in this regard.
If .tld was available as an actual top level domain you could register, I‚Äôd get one.
We had to say goodbye to our dog of 9 years yesterday. She was a rescue, and we think about 11 years old. I‚Äôm missing her more than I expected.

item.title: Missed Metal
item.description:
Another metal show was in town last night, but I couldn‚Äôt justify going to another one already. Hopefully Unleash the Archers and Striker come back through again soon.

I‚Äôll also be missing After the Burial, Acacia Strain and Erra next week, and I‚Äôll likely also have to pass on Cannibal Corpse on ‚Äòmetal day‚Äô 11-11.
Well, Trill sounds interesting: From the iOS App Store ‚Äî- Tap to meet the 17-year-old co-creator of Trill, a supportive social network.

At my second metal concert of the fall: Goatmill (who I, unfortunately, had to miss), Wolfheart, Mors Principium Est, and Carach Angren.

MPE is up right now (and oddly missing their bass player). Wolfheart was excellent! Excited for CA soon! üé∏ü§ò
I support the EFF. Do you? [Protect the Free, Fair, and Open Internet Electronic Frontier Foundation](https://supporters.eff.org/donate/sb822-victory-c)

Just listened to the latest episode of the Release Notes podcast.

And now looking forward to a future conference talk by @joec on the virtues of unit testing.

üòú

(Dismounts high horse /) (Logs a soda in a slick app /)

My wife is an incredible woman. Today marks 23 years of marriage with her. The phrase ‚Äúbetter half‚Äù doesn‚Äôt do her justice.

I am very lucky, indeed.

I can see an argument for this being a federal, not state, decision ‚Äî and yet, since the FCC has been bought‚Ä¶

Go Cali, Go!

apple.news

Trump administration to sue California over tough net neutrality law - The Washington Post

At my first metal concert of the fall: Obscura, Beyond Creation, Archspire, Inferi, Exist, Well of Night.

First 4 sets done; two to go.

At the infamous Alrosa Villa.

Realized I first saw a show here in 1992: Dream Theater for ‚ÄòImages & Words.‚Äô

item.title: Status, Reminder, Perspective
item.description:
I started a new contract earlier this month, and have been working a lot, learning a lot, and enjoying it. I‚Äôm still working with Swift, but also adding (or, in some cases, dusting off) other skills ‚Äî which was a primary goal for myself this year.

But I‚Äôve also been almost entirely off social media as a result.

This has happened before, but it is a reminder that when I am engaged enough in other things, I don‚Äôt really miss it.
I‚Äôm really enjoying a friend‚Äôs secondary Instagram account. Old-timey photos with robots, and captions that provide glimpses into their stories ‚Äì what‚Äôs not to like?

I‚Äôve just begun listening to the book ‚ÄúThe Order of Time‚Äù by Carlo Rovelli.

My takeaway so far? Date-time programming libraries are even more worthless than I thought.

Today, I‚Äôm working with Go, Python and Swift.

It‚Äôs a good day.

These pins are on my desk. I want to clean my desk.
Pondering where to put them‚Ä¶ ü§î
Current status: checking Micro.blog on my iPhone X (and getting a badge!) as I wait for the Szechuan chicken take out I will consume while watching Apple introduce the iPhone XS (or whatever). ü•°
TFW you are waiting for your machine to boot from an external drive for the third time today. üï∞

I had high hopes for kicking off the week with some serious productivity.

Now, though, I think the best course of action may be to just go to bed early and try again tomorrow. üò°üò¢ü§£üôÑüò¥

I somehow ended up with too many Mastodon accounts.

And I haven‚Äôt ruled out making a new instance I can control/own. üôÑ

My daughter‚Äôs new laptop cover has begun its sticker journey. I think she‚Äôs picked good ones to start!

  1. Smokey Bear ‚ÄúResist‚Äù
  2. Micro.blog icon ‚Äòword bubble with star‚Äô

Thanks to @macgenie for the second one!

Sigh. Someday I‚Äôll have a perfect activity ring month. 6 minutes shy on the exercise ring in August. üôÑ

At least I managed to get a new badge for September 1st! üí™
Speaking of ‚Äúyou guys,‚Äù who remembers this?
I have been enjoying Mastodon, and I still enjoy Pnut.io, but I may further simplify down to just one social service. And if I do, it‚Äôll be M‚Ä¢B.

I‚Äôm too cool to congratulate @brentsimmons on the NetNewsWire news that I saw on the ‚Äònet. üòé

(Actually, I think I initially heard about it via the ol‚Äô RSS wire‚Ä¶)

But, seriously, that is pretty cool, Brent.

I will continue to work on it, but I‚Äôm finding ‚Äúyou guys‚Äù a hard verbal habit to break.

It is not only ingrained, but ‚Äúyou all‚Äù feels off-brand (I guess) and I need to become better acquainted with other alternatives for the intended sentiment.

Any suggestions?

Had a great time at 360iDev this week. I‚Äôm glad I got to attend the Micro Meetup with @macgenie this year.

And now, as I travel back home, I‚Äôm declaring social timeline bankruptcy. So if I missed anything good, lemme know! :)

item.title: Mobile Backups are Mobile
item.description:
I‚Äôm traveling this week for a conference. I learned, many years ago, that my local backups (which I have in addition to my off-site backups) are less useful if I don‚Äôt have a way to efficiently get at them while on the road.

Once, I had a total MBP failure while on a trip. Not. Good.

Thankfully, I was not far from an Apple Store for a replacement computer at the time, but my files ‚Äì and my client‚Äôs files‚Äî were a different story.

So, now I take a (password-protected & encrypted) SuperDuper! backup drive with me and put it in the hotel room safe when I travel with my laptop.

My other (Carbon Copy Cloner, etc) local ‚Äîand also protected/encrypted‚Äî backups stay put at the home/office (in a fire safe).

I still have access to my (also encrypted) off-site backups, but in the case of a total failure it is valuable to have something on-hand ‚Äìand not be at the mercy of hotel/conference WiFi for‚Äì to restore from and get back to work with as quickly as possible.

Anybody else have redundant, neurotic, and/or secure backup schemes like this?

After being woken up by a smoke detector (no idea why it went off), and subsequently dealing with the alarm co. and fire dept., I can feel my adrenaline slowly fading and think I may try to go back to sleep.

item.title: Talk to you later, Facebook & Twitter
item.description:
I just posted these.

Facebook

I‚Äôm going to take a little time away from Facebook ‚Äî and, to a lesser extent, Twitter and other closed social networks.

The next few months will be busier than normal for me; I‚Äôll be focused on other things. More than that, I‚Äôm re-evaluating the cost-benefit of closed-network social media for myself.

6 years ago today I joined App.net. ADN itself isn‚Äôt around anymore, but the ideas and community are. So, it seems like a fitting day to ‚Äòdrop off‚Äô here.

Twitter

I‚Äôm going to start spending less time on Twitter. The next few months will be busy ones for me, anyway.

6 years ago today I joined App‚Ä¢net. ADN itself isn‚Äôt around anymore, but the ideas and community are. So, it seems like a fitting day to ‚Äòdrop off‚Äô here.

Instagram

I think I‚Äôm going to start spending less time on Instagram than I have been. I‚Äôll be focusing more on open platforms instead. ü§òüé∏ü•É

I did not deactivate or delete my accounts. I did not delete posts. I kind of doubt I will ever do that.

For the time being, I‚Äôll still be active here on Micro.blog, on Pnut.io and on Mastodon.social, albeit maybe a bit less often.

item.title: Method of the Month
item.description:
Last night I was back at our local Ruby users group for the first time in a long time. I was thrilled to see that a lightning talk ‚Äúseries‚Äù I used to give has been resurrected!

I‚Äôve given a dozen or so Method of the Month presentations for Ruby (and JavaScript) in the past, and I‚Äôve been thinking of bringing them back for CocoaHeads, so this is great inspiration to do it.

Oh, damn! I just remembered I still have the domain, though I‚Äôve done nothing with it yet. ü§¶üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
I was trying out the ‚ÄòTime Machine‚Äô feature in the updated Dark Sky weather app, and happened to notice that, apparently, I was born exactly 17,500 days ago.
